questions.question: Which Nigerian military leader is credited with introducing the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) scheme?
What event led to the suspension of the Nigerian Second Republic in 1983?
Which Nigerian military ruler was in power when the OAU (Organization of African Unity) was formed in 1963?
Which Nigerian military ruler was responsible for creating the infamous 'Maitatsine' sect during the 1980s?
Which Nigerian military regime abolished the regional structure in favor of states in the 1970s?
Which country did Nigerian peacekeepers intervene in as part of the ECOMOG peacekeeping force during the civil war in the 1990s?
What was the main objective of Nigeria's military intervention in the Chad Civil War in the 1980s?
options: To ensure the flow of oil to Nigeria
To protect Nigerian borders from threats
To prevent the spread of insurgency
questions.answer: To protect Nigerian borders from threats

questions.question: Which Nigerian military leader is credited with the 'War Against Indiscipline' campaign aimed at promoting national discipline?

Which Nigerian city became the capital after Lagos in 1991?
Which Nigerian military leader was known for his crackdown on political dissent and the press during his rule in the 1990s?
Which Nigerian general was in power when the country hosted the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) in 2003?
What is the primary goal of Nigeria's current military strategy?
Which country did Nigeria intervene in with military forces during the ECOMOG mission in the early 1990s?
Which Nigerian military leader created the Directorate of Military Intelligence (DMI) to monitor political dissent?
What is one significant issue facing Nigerian civil-military relations today?
What is the significance of the 1966 military coup in Nigeria?
options: It led to the establishment of the First Republic.
It was the first military intervention in Nigeria's politics.
It ended colonial rule in Nigeria.
questions.answer: It was the first military intervention in Nigeria's politics.

questions.question: Which Nigerian military leader handed over power to a civilian government in 1979?
What was a key cause of the Nigerian Civil War (1967–1970)?
options: Ethnic tensions and secession by Biafra
questions.answer: Ethnic tensions and secession by Biafra

questions.question: Which Nigerian regime introduced the Structural Adjustment Program (SAP) in the 1980s?
What is the term for the return to civilian rule in Nigeria in 1999?
Which Nigerian military ruler initiated the creation of Abuja as the Federal Capital Territory?
Who was Nigeria's first military head of state?
Which Nigerian civilian president had previously served as a military head of state?
What was the primary reason for the military's repeated intervention in Nigerian politics?
Which Nigerian military ruler was assassinated in a coup in 1976?
Which Nigerian military regime established the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC)?
What role did the Nigerian military play in the ECOMOG peacekeeping missions?
options: Led peacekeeping operations in West Africa
questions.answer: Led peacekeeping operations in West Africa

questions.question: Which Nigerian general declared a 'no victor, no vanquished' policy after the Civil War?
In which year did Nigeria transition to its Fourth Republic?
What is the significance of the June 12, 1993, elections in Nigeria?
options: It marked the beginning of military rule.
It was widely regarded as the freest and fairest election.
It resulted in the establishment of the First Republic.
It led to the Nigerian Civil War.
questions.answer: It was widely regarded as the freest and fairest election.
